articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Kwisong Saltern
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Kwisong Saltern
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, chairman of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, visited the Kwisong Saltern to learn about the salt production from underground ultra-saline water by the KPA.
					 Saying that he could hardly go to sleep after receiving a report that the People's Army turns out a large quantity of salt on a small field by introducing the method of salt production with underground ultra-saline water, he expressed pleasure over the fact that a bright prospect was opened up for fully meeting the national economy's growing demand for salt.
					
					 He acquainted himself in detail with the economic effectiveness of the new salt production method, comparing it with the previous method based on seawater.
					
					 In order to obtain salt from seawater, there should be reservoir, preliminary evaporating pond, evaporating pond and crystallization pond, but only evaporating pond and crystallization pond are needed to produce salt from underground ultra-saline water, several times higher in concentration than seawater. So, half of the present area of salt fields can be used for aquaculture, he noted.
					
					 He said that salt from underground ultra-saline water is tasty as it has less brine than that from seawater and it is of very high utility value in promoting the people's health and producing foodstuff, cosmetics and other basic necessities as it contains much potassium and iodine and less heavy metal.
					
					 There are rich underground ultra-saline water resources of great economic value in the west coastal area of our country, he said, adding: The relevant sector should vigorously prospect the promising fields of underground ultra-saline water and the salterns across the country should positively introduce the method of producing salt with underground ultra-saline water to radically boost the production of salt essential to the people's livelihood and the economic development.
					
					 Saying that the Party's policy should be implemented the way the People's Army does, he asked with great satisfaction for conveying his high appreciation and greetings to the soldiers who made a turning point in the country's history of salt industry.
					
					 The salt production from underground ultra-saline water is now at the start, but its prospect is rosy and it is an important way of solving the salt problem, he said, adding: The People's Army should continue to take the lead in piling salt and generalize its success and experience widely.
					
					 He stressed that the salt production sector should conduct a dynamic drive for producing salt in a larger quantity and thus supply enough salt urgently needed by various sectors of the national economy.
					
					 He was accompanied by Hwang Pyong So, Pak Yong Sik, O Su Yong and Jo Yong Won.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Leaves Malabo
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Leaves Malabo
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, left Malabo on Monday after participating in the inauguration ceremony of the Equatorial Guinean president and paying an official visit to the country.
					 He was accompanied by Sin Hong Chol, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and other suite members.
					
					 He was seen off by Prime Minister Vicente Ehate Tomi, vice prime ministers and other high-ranking officials of Equatorial Guinea and Kwak Ji Hwan, DPRK ambassador to Equatorial Guinea, and staff members of his embassy.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Sends Message of Thanks to President of Equatorial Guinea
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Sends Message of Thanks to President of Equatorial Guinea
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of thanks to Obiang Nguema Mbasogo, president of the Republic of Equatorial Guinea, leaving Malabo after visiting Equatorial Guinea.
					 Kim in the message said that he was pleased with the successful presidential inaugural ceremony amid the keen interest of the international community.
					
					 His visit offered him an opportunity to witness for himself the achievements made by the government and people of Equatorial Guinea for the socio-economic progress under the correct guidance of the president and, especially, to see the president enjoying deep trust from the government and people of the Equatorial Guinea, he said.
					
					 He recalled that he had a sincere and fruitful exchange of views with the president on the issue of steadily boosting with dynamism the relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries and other issues of mutual concern.
					
					 He noted with satisfaction that his visit to Equatorial Guinea marked a meaningful occasion of deepening the understanding and friendship between the peoples of the two countries and promoting the development of the bilateral relations.
					
					 The message wished the government and people of Equatorial Guinea fresh progress and prosperity and the president good health and bigger success in his responsible work.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets to Eritrean President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets to Eritrean President
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Tuesday sent a message of greeting to Issaias Afewerki, president of Eritrea, on the 25th anniversary of its independence.
					 Expressing belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would grow stronger, the message wished the president and the people of Eritrea bigger successes in their work for peace, development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Dominican President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Dominican President
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday sent a congratulatory message to Danilo Medina Sanchez on his reelection as president of the Republic of Dominica.
					 The message sincerely wished the president bigger success in his responsible work, expressing belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would grow stronger.

articles.title: Talks between Delegation of WPK and Chief Members of CPC Held
articles.content:
Talks between Delegation of WPK and Chief Members of CPC Held 
Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- There took place talks between the delegation of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and chief members of the Communist Party of Cuba (CPC) at the building of the Central Committee of the CPC on Monday.
					Present at the talks from the WPK side were members of the WPK delegation led by Kim Yong Chol, member of the Political Bureau and vice-chairman of the C.C., the WPK, Pak Chang Yul, DPRK ambassador to Cuba, and from the CPC side Salvador Antonio Valdes Mesa, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the CPC and vice-president of the Council of State of Cuba, and other chief members of the CPC.
					
					At the talks both sides informed each other of the activities of their parties.
					
					The head of the delegation of the WPK referred to the fact that Kim Jong Un, chairman of the WPK, sent the delegation to Cuba this time, saying that Kim Jong Un is attaching great importance to the friendly relations with Cuba provided by the great leaders with their efforts.
					
					He informed in detail that Kim Jong Un in his report made at the 7th Congress of the WPK comprehensively reviewed the brilliant victory and success registered by the WPK, army and people of the DPRK under the uplifted banner of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism in the period under review and indicated the strategic line and tasks for accomplishing the cause of socialism.
					
					He stressed that the historic 7th Congress of the WPK elected Kim Jong Un as chairman of the WPK reflecting the unanimous will and desire of all party members, service personnel and people.
					
					Congratulating the CPC on its successful 7th congress on behalf of the WPK, he highly appreciated the leadership role of the CPC which is firmly adhering to the principle of socialism while directing efforts to the political and ideological education among the people including the new generation.
					
					The head of the Cuban side informed that the 7th Congress of the CPC reviewed the work on implementing the line and decision going with the fresh socio-economic policy and discussed the issue of formulating the theory on socialist construction in Cuba and completing it.
					
					He said that the congress worked out the plan for developing the national economy for until 2030 in orientation of keeping true nature of socialism and stressed the issue of securing the monolithic leadership of the CPC and adhering to the idea of Fidel based on Marxism-Leninism.
					
					On behalf of the CPC, he sincerely congratulated the WPK on holding its 7th congress as the historic one reviewed the great victory and success made in building socialism over past 35 years and significant one showed the picture of the DPRK advancing toward the world.
					
					He wished the WPK and Korean people big success in their struggle for carrying out the decisions made at the Party's congress under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					At the talks held in a comradely and friendly atmosphere both sides discussed the matter of further developing the friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties and two countries and exchanged views on the matters of mutual concern.
					
					The WPK delegation was invited to a reception hosted by the CPC Central Committee on the same day.

articles.title: WPK Delegation Lays Wreath before Jose Marti Monument
articles.content:
WPK Delegation Lays Wreath before Jose Marti Monument 
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) on a visit to Cuba laid a wreath before the Jose Marti Monument at Revolution Square in Havana on May 23. 
					 Present at a wreath-laying ceremony were members of the WPK delegation led by Kim Yong Chol, member of the Political Bureau and vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the WPK, Pak Chang Yul, DPRK Ambassador to Cuba, Jorge Arias Diaz, deputy head of the International Department of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Cuba, and other officials concerned.
					
					 The participants laid a wreath in the name of the WPK delegation and paid tribute.
					
					 The members of the delegation looked round the Jose Marti Memorial.

articles.title: Talks between Vice Chairman of C.C., WPK and Secretary General of MLFP Held
articles.content:
Talks between Vice Chairman of C.C., WPK and Secretary General of MLFP Held
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- Talks between Ri Su Yong, member of the Political Bureau and vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), and Eliseu Joaquim Machava, secretary general of the Mozambique Liberation Front Party (MLFP) were held in Pyongyang on Tuesday.
					 Present at the talks were Pak Kun Gwang, vice department director of the C.C., WPK, and other officials of the Party Central Committee and members of the delegation of the MLFP.
					
					 At the talks both sides informed each other of the activities of their parties, discussed the matter of further developing the bilateral relations and exchanged views on the matters of mutual concern.
					
					 The secretary general extended warm congratulations to supreme leader Kim Jong Un on his election as chairman of the WPK at its 7th congress on behalf of Filipe Nwussi, president of the Republic of Mozambique who is chairman of the MLFP, and the party.
					
					 He stressed that the MLFP would expand and develop the friendly and cooperative relations with the WPK at a high level.

articles.title: Delegation of Mozambique Liberation Front Party Feted
articles.content:
Delegation of Mozambique Liberation Front Party Feted
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) hosted a reception on Tuesday for the delegation of the Mozambique Liberation Front Party on a visit to the DPRK.
					 Present there on invitation were members of the delegation of the Mozambique Liberation Front Party headed by Secretary General Eliseu Joaquim Machava.
					
					 Present there were Ri Su Yong, member of the Political Bureau and vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the WPK, Pak Kun Gwang, vice department director of the C.C., the WPK, and other officials of the Party Central Committee.
					
					 Ri Su Yong in a speech expressed deep thanks to the Mozambique Liberation Front Party for sending full support and encouragement to the WPK and the Korean people in their struggle for building a thriving socialist nation and reunifying the country.
					
					 He noted that the WPK would make positive efforts for steadily boosting the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation with the Mozambique Liberation Front Party.
					
					 Eliseu Joaquim Machava said in a speech that through his visit to the DPRK, he more keenly felt that the history and tradition of the friendly relations between the two countries provided by President Samora Moises Machel and President Kim Il Sung are developing generation after generation.
					
					 He expressed the firm stand of his party and government to develop the friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties and two countries in various fields in a more extensive and profound manner.

articles.title: Ministry of People's Armed Forces Again Sends Notice to South Side's Military Authorities
articles.content:
Ministry of People's Armed Forces Again Sends Notice to South Side's Military Authorities
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- The Ministry of the People's Armed Forces of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK sent a notice to the south side's military authorities on May 21, proposing holding a working-level contact for opening the north-south military authorities' talks.
					 It was the proposal of the Korean People's Army to ensure durable peace and security on the Korean peninsula at an early date, true to the noble intention of the Workers' Party of Korea to solve all the issues through dialogue and negotiations such as practical step for defusing military tension and the danger of clash between the north and the south.
					
					 However, the south side's military authorities are giving impression that the situation on the peninsula remains tense due to the self-defensive measure taken by the DPRK including the step for bolstering the nuclear force and spreading such absurd assertion that the DPRK's proposal for dialogue is aimed to weaken international cooperation for "sanctions against the north" and create "discord in the south", far from actively responding to the broadminded proposal. They are even making such provocative remarks that "precedence should be given to denuclearization", chilling the desire of all Koreans to open a broad avenue to the improvement of inter-Korean relations through national reconciliation and unity.
					
					 The service personnel and people of the DPRK remain unchanged in their will to settle the present catastrophic inter-Korean relations through dialogue and negotiations, not by military standoff and clash.
					
					 For this reason the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces of the DPRK sent again the following notice to the south side's military authorities Tuesday:
					
					 The purpose of the military authorities' talks is not to call in question what is the principal reason for creating the military tensions on the Korean peninsula and who is to blame for them.
					
					 The opening of the inter-Korean military authorities' talks reflects all Koreans' expectation and desire for immediate discussion and solution to pressing issues such as the danger of military clashes along the Military Demarcation Line and in the hotspot of the West Sea which may spark physical confrontation right now.
					
					 A spark of clash is bound to spill over to a war between the north and the south and it is the Korean nation who will fall victim to it.
					
					 Nothing can be a prerequisite or excuse for denying dialogue and shunning negotiations, the best way of settling all issues.
					
					 To refuse to meet, misusing an important issue decisive of the rise and fall of the Korean nation for achieving an absurd political purpose, is nothing but a far-fetched assertion that convinces no one.
					
					 The DPRK remains unchanged in its stand to hold a working-level contact for opening the north-south military authorities' talks late in May or early in June.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should immediately respond to the DPRK's proposal for ensuring peace of the country and security of the nation by deescalating the acute military tensions between the north and the south.

articles.title: DPRK Permanent Representative at UN Sends Letter to UN Secretary General
articles.content:
DPRK Permanent Representative at UN Sends Letter to UN Secretary General
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- The permanent representative of the DPRK at the UN sent a letter to UN Secretary General Ban Ki-Moon on Monday.
					 The letter said:
					
					 I write to kindly request the viewpoints of Your Excellency, the UN Secretary General, believing that there is a serious legal contradiction in the "sanctions resolutions" in which the UN Security Council has determined the nuclear tests and peaceful satellite launches conducted by the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, the DPRK as a "threat to international peace and security".
					
					 The UN Security Council has so far adopted resolution 1718(S/RES/1718), resolution 1874(S/RES/1874), resolution 2094(S/RES/2094) and resolution 2270(S/RES/2270) in 2006, 2009, 2013 and 2016 regarding the first, second and third nuclear test and the first hydrogen bomb test respectively.
					
					 The issue here is pp9 and op 1 of resolution 1718, pp8 of resolution 1874, pp7 of resolution 2094 and pp11 of resolution 2270 which have determined the nuclear tests and satellite launches of the DPRK as a "threat to international peace and security".
					
					In this regard, I hereby would like to raise the following questions.  
					
					The first question is on what is the legal ground for determining the DPRK's nuclear tests and satellite and ballistic rocket launches as a "threat to international peace and security" in the UN Security Council "sanctions resolutions".
					
					 Nowhere in related international laws including the UN Charter, the UN General Assembly resolutions, the CTBT, the NPT, the Outer Space Treaty, etc. can we find a single provision that nuclear tests are determined as a "threat to international peace and security".
					
					 The second question is why the UN Security Council has never made an issue of nor enforced any sanctions on the United States and other countries regarding their nuclear tests made over 2 000 times, ongoing regular satellite and ballistic rocket launches, if any nuclear test or satellite or ballistic rocket launch is considered as a "threat to international peace and security". 
					
					 Third, in case of no convincing legal clarification is given on the above questions, it will be concluded that the UN Security Council has gone beyond powers, lost impartiality which is vital for international organizations and committed an act of double standard, by behaving trickily with the application of the article 39 Chapter 7 the UN Charter which stipulates that the UN Security Council shall determine the existence of any threat to international peace and security before taking any action on sanctions.
					
					 I look forward to receiving a reply of legal clarification from the UN Secretariat.

articles.title: Spokesman for DPRK Foreign Ministry on Terror Incidents in Syria
articles.content:
Spokesman for DPRK Foreign Ministry on Terror Incidents in Syria
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK Tuesday gave the following answer to the question put by KCNA as regards the grave terror incidents in Syria:
					 Terrorists carried out a series of suicide bombings in Tartous City, and Jableh City, Latakia Province of Syria on Monday, leaving more than 100 people dead.
					
					 These terror incidents are the products of despicable plots of terrorists and forces backing those terrorists to hinder the peaceful settlement of the crisis in Syria and create difficulties in the way of the struggle of the Syrian army and people to defend its sovereignty, territorial integrity and security.
					
					 It is the consistent stand of the DPRK government to oppose all forms of terrorism.
					
					 We reiterate our full support and solidarity with the just struggle of the government and people of the Syrian Arab Republic to foil the hostile forces' challenge and aggression moves and achieve security, stability and territorial integrity of the country.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Reunification Policies Supported by Presidium Member of C.C., DFRK
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Reunification Policies Supported by Presidium Member of C.C., DFRK
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- Kang Ryon Hak, Presidium member of the Central Committee of the Democratic Front for the Reunification of Korea (DFRK), made public a statement on Tuesday in support of the national reunification policies clarified by Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					 Kim Jong Un in his report made at the 7th Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea set forth the national reunification policies on achieving national independence and great national unity, ensuring peace and realizing reunification by federal formula, Kang noted, expressing full support to the policies, recognizing that they are the most just policies correctly reflecting the lawful requirements of the cause of national reunification and the aspiration and desire of the nation and serve as an immortal banner dynamically arousing all the fellow countrymen to great national unity.
					
					 Noting that the cause of national reunification itself is the cause of re-linking the blood ties of the nation and achieving the national unity, he went on:
					
					 Nothing is more important than achieving great national unity in order to bring earlier the country's reunification.
					
					 The great national unity precisely means the country's reunification and powerful reunified nation.
					
					 Only when all Koreans from all walks of life in the north and the south and abroad get united as one, irrespective of ideology, social system and religious belief, can they achieve the country's reunification.
					
					 The entire Korean nation should positively turn out in the drive to achieve national reunification, the cherished desire of the nation, under the uplifted banner of the great national unity true to the noble intention of the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 Kang expressed firm belief that all Koreans from all walks of life in the north and the south and abroad would actively join in the drive to achieve the great national unity with their single-minded patriotic desire for reunification, irrespective of ideology, social system, political view, religious belief, affiliation and ism in hearty response to the patriotic appeal made by Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Nationwide Patriotic Drive for Reunification Is Sure to Emerge Victorious
articles.content:
Nationwide Patriotic Drive for Reunification Is Sure to Emerge Victorious
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- The line and policies for national reunification set forth by Marshal Kim Jong Un are the encyclopedic great programmes for reunification as they give perfect answers to all urgent issues arising in radically improving the north-south relations and opening up a wide avenue to national reunification. They are evoking a lively response at home and abroad as they are just and fair and reflect his warm love for the country and nation.
					 Ri Jong Hyok, director of the National Reunification Institute, said this in a statement on Tuesday.
					
					 Noting that supreme leader Kim Jong Un laid down a new line and policies for national reunification to weather the prevailing ordeals and indicated the ways for implementing them at the Seventh Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea, he fully supported them.
					
					 The statement went on:
					
					 The history of the inter-Korean relations and reality clearly prove that it is possible to pull down the barrier of division and open up a wide avenue to independent reunification when all Koreans unite close as one irrespective of ideology, ism, political view and religious belief, cherishing great ambition for national reunification. But national reunification can never be achieved and the Korean people would only meet miserable disaster of war when the south Korean authorities resort to the moves for confrontation with the fellow countrymen in the north, seeking "unification of social systems," pursuant to the outsiders' moves to split and alienate Koreans.
					
					 Whether to put the earliest possible end to the nation's distress-torn  history in which it has undergone pain and misfortunes resulting from the division for more than seven decades due to outside forces and fling the door open for independent reunification or not depends on how to implement the fresh line and policies for national reunification.
					
					 There are still big obstacles and ordeals in the way of national reunification, but the entire Korean nation's patriotic drive for reunification to build a dignified, prosperous and reunified power on this land is sure to emerge victorious.

articles.title: Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- A delegation of officials of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan Tuesday visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill.
					 They laid bunches of flowers before the statues of the great leaders and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Delegation of Chongryon Officials Arrives Here
articles.content:
Delegation of Chongryon Officials Arrives Here
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- A delegation of officials of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) led by Jong Tong Ju, vice-department director of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon, arrived here on Tuesday.

articles.title: Modernization of Railways Promoted in DPRK
articles.content:
Modernization of Railways Promoted in DPRK
Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- Teachers and researchers of Pyongyang University of Railways in the DPRK have paid big efforts to modernizing the country's railways.
					They settled technical problems arising in the normal operation of newly-made subway train and its serial production.
					
					They also perfected stationary and mobile rail butt-welders in a technical aspect and made a breakthrough in laying non-point of contact rails and high-speed track.
					
					At the Kim Jong Thae Electric Locomotive Complex, researchers completed miniatures of 10-odd buildings and promoted the modernization of production processes.
					
					They are now working hard to solve the sci-tech problems arising in speeding up the construction of Hyesan-Samjiyon broad-gauge railway.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Receives Floral Basket from National Democratic Congress of Ghana
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Receives Floral Basket from National Democratic Congress of Ghana
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un Tuesday received a floral basket from the National Democratic Congress of Ghana on his election as chairman of the Workers' Party of Korea.

articles.title: DPRK Young Footballers Back Home
articles.content:
DPRK Young Footballers Back Home
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- A DPRK team returned home Tuesday after coming first at the AFC U-14 Girls' Regional Championship 2016 for East zone.
					 Won Hyang Son won the best player and top scorer prize.

articles.title: Method of Mass-cultivating "Aeguk Grass" Established
articles.content:
Method of Mass-cultivating "Aeguk Grass" Established
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- The Democratic People's Republic of Korea established a new method of mass-cultivating "Aeguk Grass", a high-yielding and nutritive fodder crop.
					 According to Kim Kyong Suk, teacher of Pyongyang University of Urban Management Science, the new method based on growing point culture helps increase its seedling production.

articles.title: Collagen-Calcium Capsule Developed in DPRK
articles.content:
Collagen-Calcium Capsule Developed in DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- The Kyongsubong Trading Company of the DPRK has recently developed collagen-calcium capsule, health foodstuff.
					 According to its developer Kim Jong Hwi, the capsule contains collagen peptide, calcium, vitamin C and other ingredients essential to metabolism of bone and skin and growth.
					
					 It is efficacious in the relief of ostealgia caused by osteoporosis and knee articulation and lumbar pains by arthrosteitis.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Demands S. Korean Authorities Stop Their Military Provocations against DPRK
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Demands S. Korean Authorities Stop Their Military Provocations against DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- The south Korean military authorities are busy with dangerous saber-rattling at a time when the desire for national reunification is growing stronger thanks to the independent line of national reunification laid down at the 7th Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea, 
					 The U.S. and south Korean warmongers have been busy with joint naval maneuvers around five islands in the West Sea such as Paekryong Island and Yonphyong Island since May 19 with Aegis destroyers belonging to the U.S. Pacific Fleet and destroyer and anti-submarine helicopter of the south Korean Navy, etc. involved. And the forces of the 1st Corps of the south Korean army are mulling staging combat hardware mobile and obstacle laying drills in Koyang, Phaju and other areas in Kyonggi Province, forefront areas, from May 23 to 27.
					
					 They announced that they would stage together with U.S. and Japanese forces a combined drill for intercepting ballistic missiles in Hawaii next month allegedly to cope with the threat from the DPRK's missiles.
					
					 These are dangerous saber-rattling aimed at chilling the climate of national reconciliation and reunification created by the line and policies for national reunification advanced by the DPRK and harassing peace and stability on the Korean peninsula and in the region.
					
					 The saber-rattling in south Korea is the main factor of stoking mistrust and conflict between the north and the south and disturbing peace on the peninsula from a historical point of view.
					
					 The history of the north-south relations proves that whenever anti- DPRK madcap military drills were staged in south Korea, the confrontation between the compatriots in the north and the south was escalated and the situation on the peninsula inched close to the outbreak of a nuclear war.
					
					 Last year alone, war exercises staged by the south Korean authorities with foreign forces under various codenames such as Key Resolve, Foal Eagle, Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military drills and Ssangyong Landing Operation pushed the north-south relations to the lowest ebb and repeatedly created such tense situation where a war might break out any moment.
					
					 A series of hard-won opportunities of dialogue and the improvement of relations between the north and the south last year were scuppered by the ceaseless saber-rattling staged by the south Korean warmongers with outside forces.
					
					 Facts go to clearly prove that no matter what good line and policies reflecting the desire of the nation are laid down, there is nothing to change and it is impossible to put an end to the vicious cycle of escalating tension as long as war drills against the DPRK continue in south Korea.
					
					 All Koreans now ardently wish to see a fresh climate for peaceful reunification of the country after the DPRK set forth the reasonable line of national reunification.
					
					 Stop to the war drills against the north is the most realistic and important matter to be certainly settled to ensure peace on the Korean peninsula and mend the north-south relations.
					
					 In order to defuse the tension on the peninsula, ensure durable peace and improve the bedeviled inter-Korean relations, the south Korean authorities should stop their military provocations aimed at invading the north, to begin with.
					
					 They would be well advised to stop their foolish act of pushing the situation on the peninsula to the brink of a war, swimming against the trend of the times and opt for promoting national reconciliation and unity as early as possible.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Observes Chongryon's Founding Anniversary
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Observes Chongryon's Founding Anniversary 
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's letter to the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) on Chongryon's 40th Anniversary, May 24, Juche 84 (1995) "On Developing the Movement of Koreans in Japan onto a New, Higher Stage" and Marshal Kim Jong Un's letter to Chongryon's 60th Anniversary, May 25, 2015 "Let Us Usher in a New Golden Age of the Movement of Koreans in Japan True to the Intention of the Great Comrade Kim Jong Il" serve as the torchlight for winning a great victory as they indicate the way for Chongryon to follow, says Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in an article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The letters of the peerlessly great men, whose truth and vitality have been powerfully demonstrated, indicate the main tasks to be fulfilled by Chongryon in its patriotic activities and ways to do so.
					
					 Chongryon should uphold President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il in high esteem forever and resolutely carry forward their idea of developing Chongryon and their leadership feats, regarding them as the everlasting programme for the movement of the Koreans in Japan, and unconditionally carry out their instructions.
					
					 Kim Jong Un represents the destiny of the country, the Korean nation, Chongryon and Koreans in Japan and is a symbol of victory and glory.
					
					 Chongryon officials and other Koreans in Japan should remain true to the idea and leadership of Kim Jong Un just as the preceding generation of Chongryon held Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il in high esteem single-mindedly.
					
					 The movement of the Koreans in Japan will more powerfully demonstrate its sure victory as long as it is under the outstanding leadership of Kim Jong Un and there are the dignified DPRK displaying the spirit and might to win steady victories under the great banner of Songun and Chongryon single-mindedly united on the basis of patriotism.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Blasts S. Korean Warmongers' Anti-DPRK Saber-rattling
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Blasts S. Korean Warmongers' Anti-DPRK Saber-rattling
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- On May 12, the south Korean military warmongers staged naval firing exercises around 5 islands in the West Sea, crying out for "retaliatory actions against provocations" from someone. Meanwhile, the south Korean defense ministry is going to stage a joint anti-ballistic missile drill, the first of its kind in the history, together with the U.S. and Japan from June under the pretext of coping with the "north's nuclear and missile threat."
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in a commentary terms this development as a dangerous military provocation aimed at throwing wet blanket over the atmosphere of national reconciliation and enthusiasm for reunification which grow strong in the wake of the DPRK's offer of new national reunification line and policies and escalating the tensions on the Korean peninsula and in the region.
					
					 Noting that the atmosphere of national reconciliation and unity is running high nationwide and the south Korean people from all walks of life are becoming increasingly vocal calling for dialogue and negotiations between the north and the south, the commentary goes on:
					
					 The south Korean authorities should stop military hostile acts of threatening the north and escalating the tensions at a crucial time when the trend of the situation is favorable for the improvement of the north-south relations.
					
					 In fact, the biggest factor of obstructing the improvement of the north-south relations is the military provocations by the south Korean authorities at present. That was why the DPRK side proposed a working-level contact for the opening of the north-south military authorities' talks for the military detente on the Korean peninsula a few days ago.
					
					 Nevertheless, the south Korean ruling forces are hell bent on the war exercises against the north, disregarding the DPRK's sincere efforts for mending the north-south relations. The south Korean ruling forces are talking volumes about someone's "provocation," but this shameless behavior can convince no one.
					
					 The prevailing situation goes to clearly prove once again who is chiefly to blame for disturbing peace and stability on the peninsula and escalating the military tension in the region.

articles.title: Minju Joson Denounces S. Korean Chief Executive's Reckless Remarks
articles.content:
Minju Joson Denounces S. Korean Chief Executive's Reckless Remarks
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- Days ago the south Korean chief executive spat out invectives against the DPRK at the "dialogue on unification" held in Chongwadae. Talking about "change, reform and provocation by the north," she unhesitatingly blustered that the north would go to "self-destruction."
					 Minju Joson Tuesday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 The south Korean chief executive's reckless remarks are another provocation going against the trend of the situation and chilling the aspiration of public mindset and can never be overlooked as the fair and reasonable line and policies for national reunification set forth at the Seventh Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea command full support and sympathy from all Koreans and other people of the world.
					
					 The DPRK's proposal for north-south military authorities' talks, in particular, is the broadminded and magnanimous one helping achieve national reunification, improve the inter-Korean relations and attain co-prosperity of the nation through dialogue and negotiations.
					
					 If the south Korean chief executive has elementary sense and discretion about reality as a politician, she would not disregard the broadminded offer and good faith to treat her as a companion for reunification and join hands with each other for reunification, not asking about her crime-woven past during which she resorted to all sorts of despicable and persistent moves against the compatriots in the north.
					
					 If the chief executive of south Korea persists in such reckless acts as now in disregard of the DPRK's compatriotic good faith at the crucial crossroads of deciding the prospect of the country and the nation, failing to come to her senses, she will undoubtedly add to her crimes and will not be able to escape severe punishment.
					
					 She would be well advised to drop doubt about the DPRK's fair and magnanimous proposal and take a right option, though belatedly.

articles.title: U.S. Is Doomed to Ruin: Minju Joson
articles.content:
U.S. Is Doomed to Ruin: Minju Joson
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- A book titled "Mission Failure" written by U.S. foreign policy expert Michael Mandelbaum, professor at Johns Hopkins University in the U.S., has drawn public interest. The writer in the book asserted that the foreign policy of the U.S., which involved itself in the disputes all over the world after the demise of the Cold War to impose upon all countries of the world the political system to its liking is now on the verge of bankruptcy. The writer made a final analysis that the U.S. recklessly interfered in the internal affairs of the countries in Africa, South America and East Europe in a bid to keep the world order favorable to it, styling itself "a world gendarme" but has repeated setbacks which were attributable to its imposition of the American-style political system upon them.
					 Commenting on this, Minju Joson Tuesday says this was a right view. Similar voices are often heard from the international community, it notes and goes on:
					
					 It was long ago the public voiced the view that the U.S. was already on the decline and doomed to ruin and now it has become an indisputable established theory.
					
					 What merits attention is that the U.S. interfered in domestic affairs of many countries in a bid to realize the world domination, but failed to achieve its aggressive purpose. Worse still, it is finding itself in an inescapable quagmire.
					
					 The reason is clear. It is because the U.S. wild ambition for world domination is no more than a pipe dream.
					
					 Oblivious of this historical lesson, the U.S. follows in the footsteps of former empires.
					
					 A house built on the sand is bound to collapse. It is as clear as noonday that the U.S. foreign policy based on the day dream of world domination is bound to go bust and it is truth that the U.S. is fated to go to ruin.
					
					 This truth will surely be proved before long.

articles.title: S. Korean Media Disclose Army's Mental and Moral Vulgarity
articles.content:
S. Korean Media Disclose Army's Mental and Moral Vulgarity
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- The south Korean media accused the army of its serious mental and moral vulgarity.
					 According to the south Korean Yonhap News on May 17, a car driven by a drunken serviceman of the army bumped against several cars after crossing the dividing line on a road in Chongju, North Chungcheong Province on the same day, leaving five persons wounded.
					
					 On May 5 a drunken noncommissioned officer of the Air Force beat people for no reason in Chongju.
					
					 On April 30, a serviceman on guard over a post in a unit of the Air Force in Chongju allowed a civilian to drive a car along the runway of the unit.
					
					 In January a serviceman of the army was arrested for sexually abusing a teenage girl in a toilet in Chongju.
					
					 According to the south Korean newspaper Herald Kyongje on May 19, a drunken soldier of a unit in Hwachon, south Kangwon Province stole his officer's car and took to flight on May 16.

articles.title: U.S. and S. Korean Military Authorities Get Frantic with Military Provocations
articles.content:
U.S. and S. Korean Military Authorities Get Frantic with Military Provocations
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- The U.S. and south Korean military authorities are persisting in their dangerous military provocations aimed at chilling the climate of national reconciliation and desire for reunification.
					 According to the south Korean YTN (Yonhap TV News), Aegis destroyers belonging to the U.S. Pacific Fleet and a destroyer and anti-submarine helicopter of the south Korean Navy, etc. are busy with combined naval maneuver from May 19.
					
					 The south Korean army is firing rifles and artillery pieces at random in the southwestern waters of the West Sea under the pretext of coping with someone's "provocation".
					
					 This saber-rattling will reportedly last till May 24.
					
					 According to the south Korean Yonhap News, the force of the 1st Corps of the south Korean army is mulling staging combat hardware mobile  and obstacle laying drills in Koyang, Phaju and other areas in Kyonggi Province from May 23 to 27, timed to coincide with the above-said saber-rattling.
					
					 The south Korean military forces declared that they would stage a joint military drill with the U.S. and Japan in Hawaii next month.

articles.title: South Koreans Denounce U.S. Experiments on Biochemical Weapons
articles.content:
South Koreans Denounce U.S. Experiments on Biochemical Weapons
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- South Koreans in Phyongthaek, Kyonggi Province, south Korea held a rally near the Osan U.S. air force base on May 21 to condemn the experiments on biochemical weapons by the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces in south Korea.
					 The participants in the rally in the letter of protest accused the U.S. army of having conducted anthrax experiment on biochemical weapons.
					
					 They noted that stunned by the disclosure of the experiments, all the south Korean people demanded a halt to the experiments and drills relating to biochemical weapons but the U.S. forces pushed ahead with the biochemical war scenario Jupiter Plan.
					
					 They demanded the U.S. military authorities punish those concerned and the U.S. president make an apology to the south Koreans.
					
					 At the end of the rally they marched to the main gate of the air force base, chanting the slogans against the U.S. moves for a biochemical war. They threw the letter of protest inside the base, braving police suppression.

articles.title: S. Korean "National Assembly" Termed "Worst Vegetable-like Assembly"
articles.content:
S. Korean "National Assembly" Termed "Worst Vegetable-like Assembly"
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- MBC of south Korea reported that the 19th "National Assembly" earned such ill-fame as "the worst vegetable-like National Assembly".
					 The 19th NA closed with the end of its last session on May 19, the radio said.
					
					 That day the session started more than 30 minutes behind schedule due to the absence of over 50 lawmakers, and at least 130 bills which had not passed during the period were cleared en masse, it charged.
					
					 The bill on revising the special law on ferry Sewol and many other bills have not passed, it said, adding the ruling and opposition parties resorted to reckless political strife at the NA.

articles.title: Environment in S. Korea Polluted by U.S. Forces
articles.content:
Environment in S. Korea Polluted by U.S. Forces
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- The environment around the U.S. military base in Puphyong District, Inchon City, south Korea has been seriously polluted, according to Yonhap News of south Korea.
					 It was disclosed that a report worked out by an engineer corps of the U.S. Army in 1991 said carcinogen organic chemical substance with strong poison was massively buried at a U.S. military base in Puphyong District, Inchon in those days.

articles.title: 7th Congress of WPK Celebrated in Japan
articles.content:
7th Congress of WPK Celebrated in Japan
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- A meeting to mark the 7th Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) was held in Tokyo on May 21.
					 Speeches were made at the meeting.
					
					 Fumihiro Himori, chairman of the Japan Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea, Takao Kamakura,  director of the International Institute of the Juche Idea, and Seiichi Sakugawa, adviser of the Japanese National Liaison Council of Societies for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, noted that the 7th Congress of the WPK was an event which clearly showed the miraculous reality of the DPRK as it frustrated every move of the imperialist forces headed by the U.S. to stifle the DPRK and defended and developed socialism.
					
					 Nam Sung U, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, said that the 7th Congress of the WPK was the glorious one of victors which proclaimed Kim Jong Un's era to the world and recorded a brilliant chapter in the history of the WPK.
					
					 He noted that the congress was of greatest significance as it elected Marshal Kim Jong Un chairman of the WPK and powerfully demonstrated to the world the might of the steel-strong single-minded unity of the whole party and the entire people rallied around him.
					
					 Ri Yong Su, chairman of the Korean Social Scientists Association in Japan, and Kenichi Ogami, secretary general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea, made reports under the titles "On the historic significance of the 7th Congress of the WPK" and "Visit to Pyongyang alive with the atmosphere of celebrating the 7th Congress of the WPK."
					
					 They referred to the fact that the congress was convened at a time when the phase of a leap forward in accomplishing the revolutionary cause of Juche was opening up.
					
					 They said that the report on the review of the work of the Party Central Committee made by Kim Jong Un at the congress was an encyclopedic political programme which gives perfect answers to all issues arising in developing the WPK, building a socialist power, achieving national reunification and carrying out the cause of global independence.
					
					 They pledged to conduct a more dynamic movement to study and disseminate the Juche idea under the uplifted great banner of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism and contribute to the friendship between the two countries.
					
					 Then the participants enjoyed a performance given to congratulate Kim Jong Un on his election as chairman of the WPK.

articles.title: Russian On-line Magazine Terms West's "Repugnancy" toward DPRK Insult to Impartial Media
articles.content:
Russian On-line Magazine Terms West's "Repugnancy" toward DPRK Insult to Impartial Media
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- The West's "repugnancy" toward the DPRK, an insult to the impartial media, has the possibility of entailing disastrous consequences not only on the Korean peninsula but also to humankind.
					 The Russian on-line magazine "New Eastern Outlook" on May 11 said this in an article titled "West's 'repugnancy' toward DPRK and danger of war"
					
					 The article continued:
					
					 Western media are reporting rumors and unproved claims about the DPRK as if they were facts.
					
					 They often find themselves in an embarrassing position while recklessly echoing the remarks of "defectors from the north" and uninterruptedly reporting baseless assertions that can be easily refuted for their explicit falsity.
					
					 But even those critical of the reality in the DPRK are admitting that there is neither homeless people nor illiterates in it.
					
					 This fact alone is enough to convince one that the DPRK is a popular country respecting human rights.
					
					 It is very important for the U.S. to dominate the Asian region. That is why the U.S. continues trumpeting about "repugnancy" towards the DPRK to justify its pursuance of strategic goals in the region.
					
					 Humankind should properly know how dangerous it is.

articles.title: DPRK's Statement Supported by Swiss Bodies
articles.content:
DPRK's Statement Supported by Swiss Bodies
 Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- The Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea on May 16 made public a joint statement in which they voiced full support for the joint statement of the DPRK government, political parties and organizations calling for hastening the final victory of the cause of independent reunification true to the peerlessly great man's noble patriotism and his immortal great programme for reunifying the country.
					 The statement said:
					
					 The DPRK government, political parties and organizations in a joint statement noted that Chairman Kim Jong Un clarified a fresh line and policies for reunifying the country at the Seventh Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 If all the Koreans uphold to the last the aboveboard line and policies and carry out them, Korea's independent reunification will be achieved smoothly.
					
					 As a matter of fact, the DPRK's access to nukes has nothing to do with the inter-Korean relations.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should stop vociferating about "provocation" by the DPRK and "its dismantlement of nukes".
					
					 As mentioned in a joint statement, there are a peaceful method and non-peaceful one to reunify Korea and the DPRK is fully ready for both of them.
					
					 The Korean people will surely build a reunified powerful nation, dignified and prosperous, under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un dirige Salina Kwisong
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un dirige Salina Kwisong
Pyongyang, 24 de mayo (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Presidente del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, dirigio en el terreno la Salina Kwisong, mientras  que hizo detallado conocimiento del estado de produccion de sal con el agua ultra-salada subterranea, que realiza el EPC.
					No podia conciliar el sueno por la alegria tras recibir un parte de que el EPC produce una gran cantidad de sal en la salina con poca area al aplicar el metodo de produccion de sal con el agua ultra-salada subterranea, subrayo el Mariscal y estuvo muy regocijado diciendo que se preparo la segura perspectiva para satisfacer la cada dia mas creciente demanda de la economia nacional sobre sal.
					
					Comparando el metodo de produccion de sal basada en agua ultra-salada subterranea con el otro anterior por el agua de mar, reconocio de modo detallado la eficiencia economica del nuevo metodo.
					
					Para producir sal con el agua de mar se necesitaban el deposito de agua, el estanque preliminar de revaporizacion, el estanque de revaporizacion y el de cristalizacion, recordo y destaco que en el caso de utilizar el agua ultra salada subterranea hace falta solo el estaque de revaporizacion y el de cristalizacion porque ella tiene la densidad de varias veces mayores que el agua de mar. Continuo que, por tanto, se necesita solo una mitad de la actual area de salina para la produccion de sal y puede usar otra mitad del area para el cultivo maritimo.
					
					Por poseer la poca cantidad de salmuera que la sal fabricada con agua de mar, la sal producida con agua ultra salada subterranea tiene un buen sabor sin amargor, mucha cantidad de calcio y yodo y poca cantidad de metales pesados, dijo y continuo que por esta razon ella tiene un gran valor en el fomento de la salud del hombre y en la produccion de alimentos, cosmeticos y otros articulos de primera necesidad.
					
					Apunto que en las zonas de la costa occidental de nuestro pais abundan los recursos de agua ultra-salada subterranea de gran valor economico e indico que a fin de aumentar considerablemente la produccion de sal, indispensable en la vida del pueblo y el desarrollo de economica, las ramas interesadas deben desarrollar las dinamicas exploraciones para buscar las perspectivas cuencas y deben aplicar activamente el metodo de produccion de sal segun el agua ultra salada subterranea en las salinas enclavas en distintos lugares.
					
					Diciendo que la politica del partido debe ser materializada como lo hace el EPC encomendo transmitir a los militares su evaluacion alta a los esfuerzos de los uniformados quienes escribieron una nueva pagina de la historia de la industria de sal del pais y mostro gran satisfaccion.
					
					Aunque esta en la etapa inicial la produccion de sal con agua ultra-salada subterranea, este nuevo metodo tiene firme perspectiva y constituye un remedio importante para la solucion del problema de sal, senalo y anadio que el ejercito popular debe poner al frente de esta labor y generalizar los exitos y las experiencias alcanzados.
					
					Dio enfasis en que la rama de produccion de sal debe librar una energica lucha por producir mucho mas la sal para suministrarlo satisfactoriamente a diversas ramas de la economia nacional.
					
					Le acompanaron Hwang Pyong So, Pak Yong Sik, O Su Yong y Jo Yong Won.

articles.title: Parte de Malabo Kim Yong Nam
articles.content:
Parte de Malabo Kim Yong Nam 
Pyongyang, 24 de mayo (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, partio el dia 23 de Malabo tras tomar parte en la ceremonia de la toma de posesion del presidente de la Republica de Guinea Ecuatorial y cumplir una visita oficial a este pais africano. 
					Partieron junto con Kim el vicecanciller Sin Hong Chol y otros acompanantes coreanos. 
					
					Kim Yong Nam fue despedido por el premier Vicente Ehate Tomi, vicepremieres y otros funcionarios  de alto rango de Guinea Ecuatorial, el embajador Kwak Ji Hwan y otros miembros de la sede diplomatica coreana en ese pais africano.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje a Obiang Nguema Mbasogo
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje a Obiang Nguema Mbasogo
Pyongyang, 24 de mayo (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio un mensaje de agradecimiento al presidente de la Republica de Guinea Ecuatorial, Obiang Nguema Mbasogo, partiendo de Malabo tras cumplir su visita a este pais africano. 
					El remitente expreso el placer por la marcha exitosa de la ceremonia de la toma de posesion del destinatario en medio de gran interes de la sociedad internacional. 
					
					Subrayo que a traves de la presente visita, vio con sus propios ojos los exitos alcanzados por el gobierno y pueblo de Guinea Ecuatorial en sus esfuerzos por el progreso socioeconomico bajo la correcta direccion del mandatario, y en particular, pudo conocer que el destinatario gana gran confianza del gobierno y pueblo de Guinea Ecuatorial.
					
					Menciono que durante su estancia, intercambio con el destinatario las opiniones sinceras y utiles sobre el desarrollo vigoroso y continuo de las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises y otros asuntos de interes mutuo.
					
					Se mostro satisfecho de que su visita a Guinea Ecuatorial se haya hecho un motivo importante para profundizar el entendimiento y la amistad entre los pueblos de ambos paises y promover mas el desarrollo de las relaciones bilaterales. 
					
					Deseo al gobierno y pueblo de Guinea Ecuatorial nuevo progreso y prosperidad, y al destinatario buena salud y mayores exitos en sus responsabilidades.

articles.title: MINFAP de CDN de RPDC vuelve a exigir a Sur de Corea aceptar su propuesta
articles.content:
MINFAP de CDN de RPDC vuelve a exigir a Sur de Corea aceptar su propuesta
Pyongyang, 24 de mayo (ACNC) -- El Ministerio de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea envio el pasado dia 21 a las autoridades militares de la parte Sur un aviso demandando el contacto de trabajo para la reanudacion de las conversaciones entre las autoridades militares de ambas partes coreanas.
					Esto fue la propuesta del Ejercito Popular de Corea destinada a asegurar lo mas pronto posible la paz y estabilidad duraderas en la Peninsula Coreana, en acato a la noble voluntad del Partido del Trabajo de Corea de solucionar a traves del dialogo y negociaciones todos los problemas pendientes inclusive las medidas realistas para prevenir la tension militar y el peligro de conflicto entre ambas partes coreanas.
					
					Pero, en vez de aceptar esta propuesta magnanima, las autoridades militares surcoreanas inducen en error la opinion publica como si la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana se agravara debido a las medidas autodefensivas de la RPDC incluyendo el fortalecimiento de las fuerzas armadas nucleares. Y divulgando a la opinion publica su insistencia absurda en que la propuesta de dialogo de la RPDC persigue el objeto de debilitar la colaboracion internacional en la "sancion anti-Norte de Corea" y fomentar la "discordia entre surcoreanos", sueltan las palabras provocativas tales como "hay que anteponer la desnuclearizacion". De esta manera, echan agua fria al deseo de todos los coreanos por abrir el ancho camino de la mejora de las relaciones intercoreanas con la reconciliacion y unidad de la nacion.
					
					Es invariable la voluntad de nuestro ejercito y pueblo de resolver las relaciones Norte-Sur en la etapa catastrofica no con el enfrentamiento y choque armados, sino mediante el dialogo y negociaciones.
					
					En este contexto, el Ministerio de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares del CDN de la RPDC vuelve a enviar el dia 24 a las autoridades militares del Sur de Corea el siguiente aviso:
					
					Las conversaciones de autoridades militares Norte-Sur que deseamos no persiguen el objetivo de investigar el orden de prioridades de la tension militar creada en la Peninsula Coreana o la responsabilidad por el respecto. 
					
					La reanudacion de las conversaciones de autoridades militares Norte-Sur refleja la esperanza y voluntad de toda la nacion de discutir y resolver cuanto antes las posibilidades de choques armados en los alrededores de la Linea de Demarcacion Militar y en la zona candente del Mar Oeste y otros problemas apremiantes que puedan ocasionar por ahora la confrontacion fisica. 
					
					Una chispa de conflicto entre ambas partes coreanas pasara inevitablemente a la guerra victimando a la nacion coreana. 
					
					Nada puede ser una premisa o un pretexto para negar y despreciar el dialogo y las negociaciones, mejor remedio para resolver todos los problemas. 
					
					En particular, el intento de eludir el encuentro entre ambas partes coreanas malempleando el problema relacionado directamente con la vida y subsistencia de la nacion persiguiendo los designios politicos y estrategicos injustos no pasa de ser una persistencia impersuasible a nadie. 
					
					Es invariable nuestra posicion de sostener el contacto de trabajo para las conversaciones de autoridades militares Norte-Sur a finales de mayo o a principios de junio. 
					
					Las autoridades surcoreanas deben aceptar sin demora nuestra demanda para preservar la paz del pais y la seguridad de la nacion mediante la eliminacion de la tension militar actual entre ambas partes.

articles.title: Representante permanente de RPDC ante la ONU envia carta al secretario general de la ONU
articles.content:
Representante permanente de RPDC ante la ONU envia carta al secretario general de la ONU
Pyongyang, 24 de mayo (ACNC) -- El representante permanente de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea ante la ONU emitio el dia 23 una carta al secretario general de la ONU. 
					La misiva revela que hay serias contradicciones juridicas en las "resoluciones de sancion" del Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU que definen como "amenaza a la paz y seguridad internacionales" las pruebas nucleares y el lanzamiento de satelites con fines pacificos de la RPDC. 
					
					La misiva solicita el criterio sobre el respecto del secretario general de la ONU y continua:
					
					El Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU aprobo en 2006 la "resolucion No. 1718" (S/RES/1718), en 2009 la "resolucion No. 1874" (S/RES/1874), y en 2013 la "resolucion No. 2094" (S/RES/2094), con respecto a la primera, segunda y tercera prueba nuclear de la RPDC. Y en 2016, cuando la RPDC realizo la primera prueba de bomba de hidrogeno, aprobo la "resolucion No.2270" (S/RES/2270). 
					
					Lo problematico es que el articulo 9 del prologo y el primer articulo del texto de la "resolucion No. 1718", el articulo 8 del prologo de la "resolucion No. 1874", el articulo 7 del prologo de la "resolucion No. 2094" y el articulo 11 del prologo de la "resolucion No.2270" definen como "amenaza a la paz y seguridad internacionales" las pruebas nucleares y el lanzamiento de satelites de la RPDC. 
					
					Al respecto, presento las siguientes preguntas:
					
					Primero, ?cual es el fundamento juridico de las insistencias de las "resoluciones de sancion" que definen como "amenaza a la paz y seguridad internacionales" las pruebas nucleares, el lanzamiento de satelites y el lanzamiento de cohetes balisticos de la RPDC?
					
					La Carta de la ONU, las resoluciones de la Asamblea General de la ONU, el CTBT, el TNP, el Tratado Espacial y otros derechos internacionales no tienen ni un articulo que define las pruebas nucleares como "amenaza a la paz y seguridad internacionales". 
					
					Segundo, ?si las pruebas nucleares, el lanzamiento de satelites y de cohetes balisticos se consideran como "amenaza a la paz y seguridad internacionales", por que el Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU no ha cuestionado ni tomado las medidas de sancion sobre mas de 2 mil pruebas nucleares y lanzamiento de satelites y de cohetes balisticos realizados por EE.UU. y otros paises?
					
					Tercero, si no se dan las explicaciones juridicas persuasibles a las citadas preguntas, se considerara que el Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU abuso de su autoridad despreciando la demanda del articulo 39 del capitulo 7 de la Carta de la ONU de "definir la existencia o no de la amenaza a la paz y seguridad internacionales" antes de tomar las medidas de sancion, y cometio la actitud de doble rasero perdiendo la imparcialidad que es la vida de la organizacion internacional. Por lo tanto, esperamos la respuesta juridica del Secretariado de la ONU.

articles.title: MINREX de RPDC expone posicion de rechazar todas formas de terrorismo
articles.content:
MINREX de RPDC expone posicion de rechazar todas formas de terrorismo 
Pyongyang, 24 de mayo (ACNC) -- A la pregunta de la ACNC formulada en relacion con el grave caso terrorista ocurrido en Siria, el portavoz del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea dio el dia 24 la siguiente respuesta:
					El dia 23, los terroristas cometieron en varias ocasiones los ataques suicidas en la ciudad de Tartous y la de Jableh de la provincia de Latakia de Siria, causando mas de 100 muertos y lesionados. 
					
					El presente caso es el producto del complot vil de los terroristas y sus patrocinadores para estorbar la solucion pacifica de la crisis de Siria y poner obstaculos en la lucha del ejercito y pueblo sirios por defender la soberania, la integridad territorial y la seguridad del pais. 
					
					Rechazar todos los tipos del terrorismo es la invariable posicion del gobierno de la RPDC. 
					
					Enviamos una vez mas el irrestricto apoyo y solidaridad con la justa lucha del gobierno y pueblo de la Republica Arabe de Siria por lograr la seguridad, la estabilidad y la integridad territorial del pais rechazando los desafios y las maniobras de agresion de las fuerzas hostiles.

articles.title: Conversaciones entre Ri Su Yong y Eliseu Joaquim Machava
articles.content:
Conversaciones entre Ri Su Yong y Eliseu Joaquim Machava
Pyongyang, 24 de mayo (ACNC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 24 en esta capital las conversaciones entre Ri Su Yong, miembro del Buro Politico y vicepresidente del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Eliseu Joaquim Machva, secretario general del Partido Frente de Liberacion de Mozambique. 
					Estuvieron presentes por la parte coreana Pak Kun Gwang, subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC y otros funcionarios del CC del PTC, y por la mozambiquena, los miembros de la delegacion del Partido FRELIMO.
					
					En la ocasion ambas partes informaron del estado de las actividades de sus respectivos partidos e intercambiaron el criterio sobre desarrollar mas las relaciones bilaterales y otros temas de interes mutuo.
					
					El secretario general mozambiqueno felicito calurosamente a Su Excelencia estimado Kim Jong Il, electo como Presidente del PTC en el VII Congreso del PTC, en nombre del presidente del FRELIMO, Filipe Nwussi, presidente de Mozambique, y en el otro de su entidad politica.
					
					   Enfatizo que su partido ampliara y desarrollara aun mas las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion con el PTC.
